content:
• Wednesday, December 30, 2015
  • RATE

    Bankrate closes sale of insurance business

    • Bankrate (NYSE:RATE) slipped 2.2% today following the wrap-up of the sale of its insuranceQuotes business, to All Web Leads.
    • All Web Leads (a portfolio company of Genstar Capital) is a customer acquisition marketing company focused on insurance.
    • It had agreed to pay $140M in cash at closing time and an additional $25M to come on the second anniversary of the closing.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM
  • SALT

    Scorpio Bulkers executing one-for-12 reverse split tomorrow

    • Scorpio Bulkers (SALT -2.1%) says it's executing a one-for-12 reverse split as of the opening of trading tomorrow.
    • Shareholders had signed off on the reverse split, which was targeted at curing a share-price listing deficiency and will reduce authorized common shares to 56.25M. Outstanding common shares will fall from about 344.2M to around 28.7M shares.
    • Common shares will get a new CUSIP and each 12 will be combined into one; no fractional shares will be issued and instead the company will provide a pro-rated cash payment.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: ANFI +8.0%. CMRX +4.2%. RIG +3.1%. SDRL +2.6%. EVEP-OLD +2.1%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: TTPH -1.1%. RRC -0.7%. ZION -0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • DIS

    Football still showing strong in 2015 TV series ratings

    • Nielsen has awarded its TV series ratings crown for 2015, and football is still the king.
    • Sunday Night Football on NBC (CMCSA -1.5%) drew 23.3M viewers to top the charts among regularly scheduled series ahead of a pair of CBS (CBS -1.1%) shows. The Big Bang Theory and NCIS drew 21.1M viewers and 20.9M viewers respectively to take the next two spots for the Tiffany network.
    • A cable monster was fourth: The Walking Dead (AMCX -1.8%) pulled 19.7M viewers.
    • Unsurprisingly, football dominated the individual-show performances, marking nine of the top 10 programs (the uninvited guest was ABC's (DIS -0.7%) broadcast of the Oscars).
    • The rest of the top 10 series: No. 5, Empire on Fox (FOX -0.9%, FOXA -1%); No. 6, Thursday Night Football (CBS, NFL Network); No. 7, NCIS: New Orleans on CBS; No. 8, Sunday Night Fooball Pre-Kick on NBC; No. 9, Blue Bloods on CBS; and No. 10, Dancing with the Stars on ABC.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 12 Comments
  • YNDX

    Yandex, Qiwi sell off as ruble makes new 2015 lows against dollar

    • The ruble has fallen to 73.5 against the dollar on a day in which oil prices once more fell below $37/barrel in response to disappointing EIA inventory data. Russia's currency has depreciated by more than 30% against the dollar since May, and nearly 20% on the year.
    • Russian search leader Yandex (YNDX -2.4%) and online payments leader Qiwi (QIWI -3%) sold off on a day the Nasdaq fell 0.8%, and the S&P 0.7%. With a day to go, Yandex is down 14% in 2015, and Qiwi down 12%. Both companies have seen much bigger declines relative to their spring highs, hit while crude was trading above $55/barrel.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • CMRX

    Steve Cohen likes Chimerix, Point72 has 5.3% stake

    • Retail investors who jumped into Chimerix (NASDAQ:CMRX) after Monday's 81% plunge should feel good about themselves because star investor Steve Cohen did the same. In a 13G filing, Cohen's Point72 Asset Management reports a 2,454,943-share position in the battered biotech, representing a 5.3% stake.
    • Previously: Bargain hunters jump into Chimerix; shares up 6% premarket (Dec. 29)
    • Previously: Chimerix's lead product candidate flunks late-stage study; shares plummet 73% premarket (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 12 Comments
  • CHLN

    China Housing shareholders approve reverse split in go-private process

    • China Housing & Land Development (NASDAQ:CHLN) stockholders have approved the company's proposed 1-for-50,000 reverse split, a key step in its go-private process.
    • The company will set up a record date for the transaction soon. If consummated, shareholders will receive one share of common stock for every 50,000, and instead of fractional shares, a cash payment of $3 per pre-transaction share. The stock closed 1.7% lower today at $2.98.
    • The deal should reduce of-record shareholders to fewer than 300 and allow for the company to pull its stock from Nasdaq.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • AMBC

    Puerto Rico partly defaulting on bonds due on Monday

    • Puerto Rico won't be making 2 of the 13 debt payments due on Jan. 4 - a $35.9M payment on the territory's Infrastructure Financing Authority, and a $1.4M payment on its Public Finance Corporation.
    • The rest of the nearly $1B in payments due on Monday will be made, including one to general obligation bondholders in which half of the payment comes from revenues clawed back from other bonds.
    • Bond insurance firms Ambac (AMBC -3.1%), MBIA (MBI -2.5%), and Assured Guaranty (AGO -1%), each of which have Puerto Rican exposure, are seeing moderate losses, Earlier today, investor Nick Vouloumanos issued an open letter to Ambac's board calling for Nader Tavakoli (interim CEO since Dec. 2014) to be named permanent CEO.
    • Earlier: Puerto Rico debt crisis comes to a head
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 22 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers +23% after Oprah spins to Twitter army

    • Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) is now up 23% off buzz created by Oprah Winfrey's first ad for the company.
    • Oprah did her part by tweeting out to her +30M followers a link to the ad yesterday.
    • Wall Street isn't particularly bullish on WTW at current levels with an average price target of $17 in place.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 15 Comments
  • DDD

    3D Systems continues falling after consumer exit; Needham expects more cuts

    • 3D Systems (DDD -3.4%) is now down 16% since announcing on Monday it's discontinuing its consumer-focused Cube 3D printer and Cubify.com site. Shares are less than $0.40 above a multi-year low of $8.44 (set on Nov. 12/13), and trade for just 1.5x a 2016 sales consensus of $666.5M.
    • Needham's James Ricchiuti has cut his 3D target by $1 to $14 today, while reiterating a Buy. He thinks the consumer exit will likely be followed by "cost actions in other speculative areas of 3D printing and adjacent markets."
    • 3D's scanner ops, its Gentle Giant Studios collectibles business, and the company's culinary efforts are seen as possible targets. "We regard these initiatives as constructive and indicative of management’s commitment to improve earnings over the next year."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • CHK

    Energy stocks see more pain after EIA data arrives

    • Hit hard two days ago as oil fell below $37/barrel, oil/gas industry names are seeing more pain today after the EIA reported U.S. crude inventories rose by 2.6M barrels last week - expectations were for a decline. The report comes shortly after the API estimated U.S. crude inventories rose by 2.9M barrels during the most recent weekly period.
    • After rising yesterday, WTI crude is down 3.1% to $36.71/barrel. Brent crude is down 2.9% to $36.69/barrel. Nymex natural gas is down 7.3% to $2.20/MMBtu.
    • The biggest decliners include Chesapeake Energy (CHK -4.1%), Petrobras (PBR -4.1%), Linn Energy (LINE -7.5%), Gulfport Energy (GPOR -5.2%), SeaDrill (SDRL -5.5%), MV Oil Trust (MVO -4.5%), EV Energy Partners (EVEP-OLD -6.7%), and Southwestern Energy (SWN -5.7%).
    • Other notable decliners include Hercules Offshore (HERO -5.2%), Marathon Oil (MRO -4%), Devon Energy (DVN -4.4%), Encana (ECA -4.1%), Range Resources (RRC -4.7%), Sandridge Mississippian Trust (SDR -4%), Newfield Exploration (NFX -3.8%), BP Prudhoe Bay Royalty Trust (BPT -3.1%), Enerplus (ERF -3.9%), and ONEOK Partners (OKS -2.5%).
    • ETFs: XLE, VDE, ERX, OIH, XOP, ERY, DIG, DUG, BGR, IYE, IEO, FENY, PXE, FIF, PXJ, NDP, RYE, FXN, DDG, DRIP, GUSH
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 68 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CDZI +31%. OHGI +25%. WTW +21%. AMSC +18%. SKY +19%. OTC:GIGA +16%. COLL +14%. AGRX +12%. NL +12%. ITUS +11%.
    • Losers: NURO -15%. UDF -14%. ABGB -13%. OTC:INVT -11%. GORO -11%. OTC:GBIM -10%. EDUC -10%. BPTH -9%. KIQ -9%. GIGM -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • BABA

    Ctrip slumps as Alibaba reportedly ends travel deal

    • China's Yibada.com reports Alibaba (NYSE:BABA) is ending its travel services partnership with Ctrip (CTRP -2.7%), through which Ctrip's offerings are promoted on Alibaba's travel platform, on Jan. 1.
    • The report comes two months after Ctrip struck a deal with Baidu to obtain a major stake in rival Qunar in exchange for Ctrip shares. Alibaba and Baidu compete in numerous markets (I, II). Alibaba launched its Alitrip travel brand in late 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 4 Comments

  • Crude futures decline further on unexpected inventory build

    • EIA Petroleum Inventories:
    • Crude +2.6M barrels vs. -2.5M consensus, -5.9M last week.
    • Gasoline +0.9M barrels vs. +0.9M consensus, +1.1M last week.
    • Distillates +1.8M barrels vs. +0.9M consensus, -0.7M last week.
    • Futures -3.50% to $36.55.
    • ETFs:USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, UWTI, USL, DWTI, DNO, SZO, OLO, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 54 Comments
  • PSG

    Performance Sports Group higher after Oppenheimer endorses

    • Performance Sports Group (PSG +1.5%) is initiated by Oppenheimer with an Outperform rating.
    • Shares of PSG have been in a rut over the last few weeks, sliding 13% to a 52-week low amid a broad sell-off in sporting good stocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • SSNLF

    Samsung/LG reportedly supplying OLEDs for iPhones; Universal Display rises

    • Korea's Electronic Times reports Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) and LG Display (LPL -0.6%) are close to final deals with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) to supply OLED displays for iPhones.
    • It adds the companies plan to spend a combined KRW15T ($12.8B) in capex over the next 2-3 years to expand their OLED capacity, and that (in-line with past deals with suppliers) Apple will likely provide some funding to help the companies with their investments. Samsung will likely get bigger order volumes than LG.
    • The report follows one from Japan's Nikkei a month ago stating Apple will launch iPhones featuring OLEDs in 2018, and that the company will work with suppliers "over the next year or so" to see if it can obtain enough displays and eliminate technical issues such as performance degradation.
    • OLED IP/materials supplier Universal Display (OLED +5.1%) is rallying once more, after having previously done so on the Nikkei report. Shares are within $3 of a 52-week high of $57.93, and up 99% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 32 Comments
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy +4.4%; Oppenheimer starts at Outperform, predicts 2016 rebound

    • Believing forex swings and strong retail headphone promo activity is "overshadowing very strong constant currency sales growth and market share gains," Oppenheimer's Sean McGowan has launched coverage on Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) with an Outperform rating and $8 target.
    • McGowan cautions recent headwinds could weigh on shares into 2016, but adds Skullcandy's results should look better a year from now. "We expect the stock to trade up to at least $8 12-18 months from now, and believe it will Outperform the broader markets."
    • The coverage comes less than two months after Skullcandy plunged due to a Q3 sales miss and light Q4 guidance. Shares -46% YTD, and trading for just 10.6x a 2016 EPS consensus of $0.47.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • MEMP

    MEMP, VNR downgraded at Morgan Stanley

    • Morgan Stanley lowers its ratings on Memorial Production (NASDAQ:MEMP) and Vanguard National (NYSE:VNR) to Equal-Weight from Overweight since their "relative company specific strengths are being overwhelmed by the macro environment."
    • Analyst Tom Abrams: "While lower commodity assumptions translate to a reduction in EBITDA forecasts, valuations in the sector could be negatively impacted by the shift to cash flow based targets."
    • The firm also reduced their price targets: Memorial Production to $6 from $8, and Vanguard National to $7 from $11.
    • MEMP -5.2%; VNR -2.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 21 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers rallies early after Oprah ad debuts

    • Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) is up 7% in premarket action as the new Oprah commercial for the company makes the rounds.
    • The meteoric rise in Weight Watchers' share price has increased the pressure for the Oprah Effect to translate into sales and profit.
    • WTW is back over $20 after peeling off some of its gains over the last few weeks. The stock traded over $80 about five years ago before a paradigm shift away from dieting toward exercise impacted sales.
    • Previously: The Oprah era begins at Weight Watchers (Dec. 29 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • SUNEQ

    SunEdison up 7.6% after debt exchange, Dominion deal news

    • SunEdison (SUNE) has risen to $5.40 premarket after announcing it's converting $336M in debt due 2020 into TerraForm Power Class A shares and renewable energy project interests.
    • The company has also announced it's buying a 33% stake in a 336MW solar project portfolio owned by Dominion for an equity purchase price of $180M plus a working capital adjustment, and simultaneously selling the stake to its Terra Nova Renewable Partners JV with JPMorgan clients.
    • The agreement represents the first part of a two-stage deal announced in September for a 567MW portfolio; the second part is expected to close in early 2016. Earlier this month, SunEdison announced it's selling 333MW of wind plants to Terra Nova for $209M.
    • SunEdison had $2.4B in cash and $11.7B in debt at the end of Q3. Last week, the company announced it's in talks for a new second lien credit facility worth up to $650M.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 4 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: OHGI +27%. SUNE +9%. ATNM +8%. WTW +7%.
    • Losers: TW -7%. LINE -6%. OTC:INVT -6%. OAS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
